alert.note: Alert for Owen; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 12:00PM EST until January 04 at 7:09PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, Grant, Owen and Pendleton. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1156 AM EST, local law enforcement reported minor flooding lingering after earlier heavy rain. While the heaviest rainfall has ended, flooding will linger into the afternoon hours. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Williamstown, Falmouth, Morgan, Corinth, Camp Northward, Cordova, Cherry Grove, Marcus, Keefer, Williamstown Lake, Lawrenceville, Goforth, Knoxville, New Columbus, Natlee, Gene Snyder Airport, Elk Lake, Beechwood, Mckinneysburg and Harmony.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
